urlV2.htmlContent:
{"detail_content": "

Discover the dark-humored adventures of Wednesday Addams, the dry witted and vengeful daughter of Morticia and Gonzo Addams. The show follows Wednesday’s life as a student at Nevermore Academy as she masters her psychic abilities and tries to end a killing spree that's left the town shaken.

What To Know

Wednesday is a comedy horror series produced by MGM television for Netflix. The series is created by Tim Burton, Miles Millar, and Alfred Gough. Tim Burton also directs several episodes of the show.

Jenna Ortega stars as Wednesday Addams, the eldest child of Morticia and Gomez Addams. Ortega is best known for her role as Ellie Alves in the second season of Netflix’s hit series, You. Also starring in the series are Catherine-Zeta Jones, who plays Morticia, Luiz Guzman, Riki Lindhome, Jamie McShane, Thora Birch, Percy Hynes White, and Gwendoline Christie. Wednesday was released on Netflix on November 23, 2022.

Production: Timeline, news & updates

  • October 2020: An untitled Addams Family project headed by iconic director Tim Burton is announced. Burton would serve as director and executive producer, with Alfred Gough and Miles Millar to be the series’ showrunners. (Source: Deadline Hollywood)
  • May 2021: Jenna Ortega is cast as the star of the series. (Source: The Hollywood Reporter)
  • August 2021: Catherine Zeta-Jones, Luis Guzman and the majority of the cast members are revealed. (Source: Deadline Hollywood)
  • September 2021: The series begins shooting in Bucharest, Romania. (Source: Midgard Times)
  • March 2022: It’s revealed that Christina Ricci will play a part in the series as a series regular. The actress previously played Wednesday Addams in both the 1991 and 1993 films. (Source: Deadline Hollywood)
  • June 6, 2022: A first look video clip of Jenna Ortega in character as Wednesday is released by Netflix. (Source: Youtube)
  • August 11, 2022: The release of a new image of the protagonist, Wednesday Addams, suggests that the show will have a modern aesthetic. (Source: Screen Rant)
  • August 17, 2022: Freshly released set photos show the Addams family together for the first time in this new-look series. (Source: ScreenRant)
  • August 17, 2022: The first full-length teaser is released showing Wednesday Addams attending Nevermore Academy after being expelled. The tagline 'Mystery, mayhem and murder' perfectly sums up the promise of the show. (Source: Screen Rant)
  • August 24, 2022: New details come to light in a featurette that centers Jenny Ortega talking about her character. She hints at Wednesday being socially awkward, an outcast and suggests that there will be murder-mystery aspects to the story. (Source: Collider)
  • September 12, 2022: Netflix releases new images of Wednesday, giving audiences a look at Nevermore Academy and its student body. (Source: Screen Rant)
  • September 21, 2022: A new welcome video about Nevermore Academy is released for fans online. Nevermore is the school Wednesday Addams' attends, and the video gives a viewers a closer look at characters like the principal played by Gwendoline Christie. The video also directs viewers to a website where fans can apply to attend the fictional school. (Source: Screen Rant)
  • September 23, 2022: Netflix announces a release date for Wednesday: it will premier November 23, 2022. (Source: Collider)
  • September 24, 2022: A new poster with the official release date is revealed online. (Source: Screen Rant)
  • September 24, 2022: A new clip for Wednesday teases Thing's appearance in the series. (Source: Screen Rant)
  • October 8, 2022: Netflix releases a new trailer that reveals Christina Ricci's character and Uncle Fester. (Source: Deadline)
  • November 10, 2022: A new featurette is released going behind-the-scenes in the creation of the Nevermore Academy. Series director Tim Burton discusses the design choices. (Source: Deadline)
  • November 23, 2022: Wednesday was released on Netflix. (Source: Netflix)
", "detail_heading": "Synopsis"}

content.shortDescription: Wednesday Addams is sent to Nevermore Academy, a bizarre boarding school where she attempts to master her psychic powers, stop a monstrous killing spree of the town citizens, and solve the supernatural mystery that affected her family 25 years ago — all while navigating her new relationships.
content.title: Wednesday

textRecommendations.headline: A darkly charming spinoff that’s just plain fun
textRecommendations.body: Whether you fell in love with the Addams Family in black-and-white or found them for the first time in the ‘90s, Wednesday captures the franchise’s lighthearted, macabre humor to a tee. Anyone wondering if Jenna Ortega can nail Wednesday’s deadpan, straight-faced menace will not be disappointed. Tim Burton adds his trademark gothic whimsy to a fleshed-out universe that sees everyone’s favorite goth at a prestigious boarding school with a supernatural twist. The other Addams don’t appear often, but they don’t need to. Ortega carries the series with the help of a strong supporting cast.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: Whether you fell in love with the Addams Family in black-and-white or found them for the first time in the ‘90s, Wednesday captures the franchise’s lighthearted, macabre humor to a tee. Anyone wondering if Jenna Ortega can nail Wednesday’s deadpan, straight-faced menace will not be disappointed. Tim Burton adds his trademark gothic whimsy to a fleshed-out universe that sees everyone’s favorite goth at a prestigious boarding school with a supernatural twist. The other Addams don’t appear often, but they don’t need to. Ortega carries the series with the help of a strong supporting cast.

profile.bio:
Jeanette White is an entertainment and video game writer who frequently laments between plopping in front of the small screen or booting up the PlayStation. While she’s a sucker for a good story, she also adores schlocky horror movies, especially of the ‘80s variety.

Experience and Education

After graduating from the University of Massachusetts Boston, Jeanette considered a career in psychology before landing her first freelance writing job. Now, she has over six years of experience writing and editing content across many pop culture subgenres. Previously, Jeanette served as the Lead Movie Features Editor at CBR, where she also interviewed industry talent and reviewed films. She is a Cherry Picks certified critic with bylines at The Mary Sue, Fangirlish, and Den of Geek, to name a few.

Favorite Movies and TV Shows

Some of Jeanette’s favorite movies include The Lord of the Rings, Psycho, Halloween, and the little-known horror flick titled Alligator. She’s a slasher connoisseur, and big franchises with increasingly worse movies are her guilty pleasure. When it comes to TV, she’s something of a Walking Dead expert, but anyone who knows her will tell you that she doesn’t shut up about The X-Files.

textRecommendations.headline: A must-see for fans of the Addams Family and Tim Burton
textRecommendations.body: It's hard to imagine a better combination in TV or film than Tim Burton, The Addams Family, and Jenna Ortega, which is why Wednesday works so well. Ortega is the perfect Wednesday Addams with her deadpan humor and brooding expression, while Burton's gothic flair and the Addams Family's eccentricities are a match made in heaven. The show truly honors the franchise but also reinvents it a bit. Adding supernatural elements, complex family dynamics, and mystery allows Wednesday to stand well on its own, making it perfect for Addams Family fans and newcomers seeking a unique, teen detective show.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: It's hard to imagine a better combination in TV or film than Tim Burton, The Addams Family, and Jenna Ortega, which is why Wednesday works so well. Ortega is the perfect Wednesday Addams with her deadpan humor and brooding expression, while Burton's gothic flair and the Addams Family's eccentricities are a match made in heaven. The show truly honors the franchise but also reinvents it a bit. Adding supernatural elements, complex family dynamics, and mystery allows Wednesday to stand well on its own, making it perfect for Addams Family fans and newcomers seeking a unique, teen detective show.

profile.bio:
Rachel Ulatowski is an entertainment writer who is passionate about TV, film, and pop culture and loves writing content that entertains and resonates with readers. She enjoys dabbling in creative writing, running, reading, and making TikToks when not writing professionally.

Experience and Education

Rachel has three years of experience writing professionally for major digital news outlets. She serves as a Staff Writer for The Mary Sue and has also written for Screen Rant, Tell-Tale TV, and Monsters and Critics.

Favourite Movies and TV-Shows

Some of Rachel's favorite movies are Nomadland, The Fabelmans, A Monster Calls, Saving Private Ryan, Stand By Me, and Forrest Gump. Her favorite TV shows include Good Omens, The Umbrella Academy, The Boys, Doctor Who, and Stranger Things.

textRecommendations.headline: A gothic coming-of-age story with enough dark humor to keep things fun
textRecommendations.body: Spinoffs, reboots, and revivals always come with a lot of expectation since they only exist because of the success of the flagship project. Luckily, Wednesday does hers justice with a darkly charming mix of murder mystery, dry wit, and supernatural weirdness, all anchored by Jenna Ortega's razor-sharp performance. The show leans into the spooky without getting too heavy, mixing classic Addams Family weirdness with a boarding school backdrop that feels part Harry Potter, part Riverdale, but way more fun than either. There's also a monster on the loose and secrets surrounding Nevermore Academy.
textRecommendations.bodyHTML: Spinoffs, reboots, and revivals always come with a lot of expectation since they only exist because of the success of the flagship project. Luckily, Wednesday does hers justice with a darkly charming mix of murder mystery, dry wit, and supernatural weirdness, all anchored by Jenna Ortega's razor-sharp performance. The show leans into the spooky without getting too heavy, mixing classic Addams Family weirdness with a boarding school backdrop that feels part Harry Potter, part Riverdale, but way more fun than either. There's also a monster on the loose and secrets surrounding Nevermore Academy.

profile.bio:
Charlene is a multifaceted writer with a deep love for pop culture, storytelling, and all things entertainment. Whether she's analyzing the latest superhero blockbuster or crafting compelling editorials, her passion shines through in every word. She loves the Backstreet Boys, advocates individuality, and is a firm believer in pancakes for dinner.

Experience and Education

With over 10 years of experience as a writer, editor, and copywriter, Charlene has built a diverse portfolio that includes entertainment journalism, lifestyle content, and politics. Her work has appeared in Glamour, GQ, HuffPost, CBR, The Sportster, and Thought Catalog, showcasing her ability to cover a variety of topics. Beyond her writing expertise, Charlene holds a Bachelor of Commerce degree, which gives her unique insight into the business side of entertainment journalism.

Favorite Movies and TV Shows

Charlene's enthusiasm for film and television runs deep. She's an avid fan of major franchises like Marvel, Star Wars, and Harry Potter. However, when it comes to personal favorites, she enjoys the escapism found in romantic comedies like 27 Dresses and Father of the Bride. She also has an inexplicable addiction to horror and true crime.

content.title: This Means Woe
content.shortDescription: When buried family secrets are unearthed, Wednesday must race against time to prevent a dark prophecy from being realized.

content.title: Woe Me the Money
content.shortDescription: As the school gala looms, Wednesday digs up dirt on Dort, Enid tries not to wolf out and Morticia engages in a battle of wills with Grandmama.

content.title: Woe Thyself
content.shortDescription: An encounter with a spirit from Nevermore's past gives Wednesday and Enid a new perspective on one another — and puts one of their classmates in danger.

Titles.title: The Twisted Tale of Amanda Knox
Ruby & Jodi: A Cult of Sin and Influence
